what are the open spaces?
on here?
were

Ok I'll be down in about 3-5 minutes.
Is there anyone that's willing to host a newb session?  I went to two days of tutorials and still feel sorta lost

@djdarkbeat sessions marked as extreme tend to run fast and furious with details. but almost all of them are trying to present a lot of ideas in a fairly short period of time. if there's a particular topic that was overwhelming, look for an open space on it. folks there tend to have much more time to give explanations.
it's a great way to get a more relaxed intro.
@steve_piercy it is like drinking from a fire hose. has been every year that i've been here. take notes, meet people, share ideas. that's the reason we're all here.
@djdarkbeat what kind of newb session did you have in mind?
I'm learning python coming from Ruby, Lasso and PHP
right
@steve_piercy Get involved with a local python user group (or start one on meetup.com!)
@djdarkbeat yep, where the tutorials were located

the hanover rooms are all available for adhoc meetings / presentation / discussions, i.e. open spaces. just inside the doors to the hanover rooms, there are a series of poster boards where you can reserve a space. look for topics that you're interested in or if there isn't one, start on.
I'm familiar with most OO concepts
but need to see code and have someone point at it and say this is what this is and this what that is
that's for sure I've participated in our ruby group locally etc
yep
I think the hanover rooms where where the tutorials are at.

and I'm fairly familiar with OOP -- loosely, just need to put it together in python
